item.title: Word of the Day: accede
item.description: This word has appeared in 60 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Super Bowl LX, Plus 6 Things on TV This Week
item.description: The Olympic Games in Milan and Cortina begin, and the Seattle Seahawks face the New England Patriots.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny is set to perform at the 2026 Super Bowl.

item.title: Archivos Epstein: estos son los poderosos mencionados en el nuevo lote
item.description: Elon Musk, Richard Branson y Sergey Brin fueron algunas de las personas que intercambiaron mensajes con Jeffrey Epstein o lo visitaron, según los documentos recién publicados.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump fue mencionado en más de una decena de pistas recibidas por la Oficina Federal de Investigación en relación con Jeffrey Epstein, pero los archivos publicados no contenían pruebas que lo corroboraran.

item.title: Elecciones en Costa Rica: Laura Fernández es la presidenta electa
item.description: Los comicios se vieron empañados por una violencia sin precedentes en el país centroamericano. La candidata del oficialismo será presidenta.
item.dc:creator: Emiliano Rodríguez Mega and David Bolaños

media:content.media:credit: Cesar Rodriguez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Laura Fernández en su mitin de cierre de campaña el jueves por la noche en San Antonio, Costa Rica.

item.title: El año de Bad Bunny: recibe el Grammy al mejor álbum
item.description: Una semana antes de su actuación en el medio tiempo del Super Bowl, la superestrella puertorriqueña ganó el premio al álbum del año, superando a Lady Gaga, Kendrick Lamar y otros.
item.dc:creator: David Browne

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny llegó a los Grammy 2026 con seis nominaciones.

item.title: How a Village in Italy Became a Slice of Caracas
item.description: Generations of migrants from a village on the coast of southern Italy found a better life in Venezuela. Many came back and turned their town into a mini-Caracas.
item.dc:creator: Fabiola Ferrero

item.title: Quote of the Day: K-Pop Stokes a Fire in Fans to, However Difficult, Learn Korean
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, February 2, 2026.

item.title: Move Fast, but Obey the Rules: China’s Vision for Dominating A.I.
item.description: Beijing wants to lead the world in developing cutting-edge artificial intelligence, but it also wants companies to adhere to an increasingly complex set of rules.
item.dc:creator: Meaghan Tobin and Xinyun Wu

media:content.media:description: Executives at Zhipu AI, one of China’s most promising A.I. start-ups, alongside others, at a launch event at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange last month.

item.title: Squeezed Between Trump and China, India Looks for Faraway Friendships
item.description: India is overcoming its aversion to free-trade deals to cozy up with Canada and other middle powers.
item.dc:creator: Alex Travelli

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, center, met with Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, and António Costa, the president of the European Council, in New Delhi in January.

item.title: No Corrections: Feb. 2, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Feb. 2, 2026.

item.title: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rican Presidency
item.description: Laura Fernández’s victory was driven by a crisis in which Costa Rica’s reputation for peace has been tarred by record-breaking violence.
item.dc:creator: Emiliano Rodríguez Mega and David Bolaños

media:content.media:credit: Cesar Rodriguez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Laura Fernández, Costa Rica’s president-elect, celebrating her election victory alongside supporters on Sunday evening.

item.title: Bad Bunny Wins Grammy for Album of the Year With ‘Debí Tirar Más Fotos’
item.description: One week before his Super Bowl halftime set, the Puerto Rican superstar won album of the year, defeating Lady Gaga, Kendrick Lamar and others.
item.dc:creator: David Browne

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny came into the 2026 Grammys with six nominations.

item.title: Unforgettable Grammys 2026 Looks: Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter, Bad Bunny
item.description: Feathered gowns, sequined suits, freed nipples and more.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

media:content.media:description: Lady Gaga was one of many artists who embraced feathers at the Grammy Awards.

item.title: Secret Filming of Women Thrives in China as Officials Silence Activists
item.description: Hidden cameras capture women in intimate moments without their consent, yet the authorities do little to stop it.
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo and Pei-Lin Wu

item.title: Kendrick Lamar Wins 2nd Record of the Year Grammy for ‘Luther’ With SZA
item.description: The rapper took the category last year with “Not Like Us.” This time, he shared the honor with SZA for their duet “Luther.”
item.dc:creator: Marc Hogan

media:content.media:description: Kendrick Lamar and SZA performed together on a stadium tour last year.

item.title: Latest Batch of Epstein Files Includes Emails From Several Prominent Men
item.description: Elon Musk, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and the N.F.L. Giants’ co-owner Steve Tisch are among the powerful men mentioned in the latest round of files released by the Justice Department as part of its investigation into the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:description: An undated photo of Jeffrey Epstein that was released by the Justice Department.

item.title: Bad Bunny dice ‘fuera ICE’ en los Grammy
item.description: Tras ganar el premio al mejor álbum de música urbana, la superestrella puertorriqueña se dirigió contra el Servicio de Inmigración y Control de Aduanas.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny al recibir la presea por Mejor disco de música urbana en los Premios Grammy del domingo

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1, Episode 3 Recap: Waking the Dragon
item.description: Dunk makes a powerful new enemy. Egg makes his true self known.
item.dc:creator: Austin Considine
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)

media:content.media:description: Dunk has provoked the dragon, a.k.a., Prince Aerion (Finn Bennett), a capital B, capital G Bad Guy.

item.title: The Subtle Marketing Move Behind Justin Bieber’s Grammys Boxers
item.description: The singer, who was nominated for four Grammys, performed at the award show in nothing but sparkly lavender shorts and socks.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

media:content.media:description: Look more closely, and the satiny shorts contained the logo for the singer’s clothing brand in tiny crystals.

item.title: Chappell Roan’s Nipple Piercing Dress Brought Naked Dressing to the Grammys
item.description: Chappell Roan’s dress draped a barely there opaque skirt from nipple piercings, and that wasn’t the only way celebrities bared their skin.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta

media:content.media:description: Chappell Roan arrived in a burgundy, opaque chiffon cape, a custom design by Mugler. Below her cape, an opaque floor-length skirt hung in place from nipple piercings.

item.title: Billie Eilish Wins Song of the Year Grammy for ‘Wildflower,’ Her 3rd in the Category
item.description: “Wildflower” beat tracks by Bad Bunny, Lady Gaga and Doechii.
item.dc:creator: Hank Shteamer

media:content.media:description: Billie Eilish performed at the 2025 Grammys with her brother, Finneas. This year she was up for both record and song of the year with “Wildflower.”

item.title: Man and Dog Found Dead Inside Mobile Veterinary Van in Queens
item.description: A second man was found unconscious outside the van. The police are investigating whether the deaths were caused by carbon monoxide from a generator.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Southall and Chelsia Rose Marcius

media:content.media:credit: Miles Cohen for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The veterinary van where a man and a dog were found dead on Sunday morning in Queens. The police are investigating whether carbon monoxide fumes from a generator, pictured, played a role in the deaths.

item.title: N.Y. Republican in Swing District Gets Rowdy Reception at Town Hall
item.description: Representative Mike Lawler, who has promised to hold several town halls as he seeks re-election, was repeatedly heckled by audience members in Rockland County.
item.dc:creator: Jay Root and Nate Schweber

media:content.media:credit: Gregg Vigliotti for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Mike Lawler, a Hudson Valley Republican, is seeking a third term in a district newly rated a “tossup” by the Cook Political Report.

item.title: Bad Bunny Says ‘ICE Out’ in Grammys Acceptance Speech
item.description: After winning the award for best música urbana album, the Puerto Rican superstar took aim at the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny accepting the award for best música urbana album during the Grammy Awards on Sunday.

item.title: Oscar-Nominated Screenwriter Arrested in Iran for Criticizing Regime
item.description: Mehdi Mahmoudian, co-writer of “It Was Just an Accident,” was one of several people detained after signing a letter objecting to the crackdown on protests.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: The Yomiuri Shimbun, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Mehdi Mahmoudian, a political activist and screenwriter, during an interview in Tehran in 2021.

item.title: La ONU advierte que corre peligro de colapso financiero por cuotas impagas
item.description: El organismo alertó que podría quedarse sin fondos en julio y verse obligado a cerrar su sede en Nueva York si los países —en particular Estados Unidos— no pagan sus aportes anuales.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: La Asamblea General, en septiembre. El secretario general de la ONU, António Guterres, envió el jueves una carta a los embajadores de los 196 Estados miembros en la que afirmó: “No puedo exagerar la urgencia de la situación a la que nos enfrentamos ahora” .

item.title: How Weight Lifting Took Over America
item.description: Fitness reporter Danielle Friedman explores the cultural history of the rise of strength training.
item.dc:creator: Theodore Tae and Danielle Friedman

item.title: Olivia Dean Caps a Rocket-Ship Year With a Best New Artist Grammy
item.description: The “Man I Need” singer defeated a fellow British vocalist, Lola Young, as well as Leon Thomas, Addison Rae and others.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Horn

media:content.media:description: Olivia Dean received her first Grammy nomination this year, for best new artist.

item.title: Otros 2 alumnos de una misma escuela, en custodia federal por operativos migratorios
item.description: El director de la escuela dijo que los llevó ante las autoridades a pedido de su madre detenida. La semana pasada, otro menor del mismo colegio, Liam Conejo Ramos, también fue detenido por agentes de inmigración.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Mervosh

media:content.media:description: La escuela primera Valley View en Columbia Heights, Minnesota, la semana pasada. Más de dos decenas de padres y cuidadores vinculados a la escuela han sido detenidos en las redadas migratorias del gobierno de Trump.

item.title: 10-Minute Challenge: A Painting of Time
item.description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.
item.dc:creator: Larry Buchanan

item.title: Kehlani, Justin Bieber and More Wear ‘ICE Out’ Pins and Support Immigrants at Grammys
item.description: Bad Bunny joined Gloria Estefan, Shaboozey, Kehlani and others in speaking up for communities that are being targeted by ICE across the United States.
item.dc:creator: Marc Tracy

item.title: James Sallis, 81, Dies; Novelist Whose ‘Drive’ Became a Hit Movie
item.description: A storyteller of modern America’s underbelly with a literary, ruminative style, he inspired a Ryan Gosling movie and earned critical acclaim.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

media:content.media:description: Mr. Sallis’s best known novel, “Drive,” became a movie starring Ryan Gosling.

item.title: Trump Says Kennedy Center Will Close for 2-Year Reconstruction Project
item.description: The president’s announcement came after the center has been rocked by cancellations and boycotts by performers, contributors and audience members.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nagourney and Julia Jacobs
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Workers adding President Trump’s name to side of the Kennedy Center in Washington in December.

item.title: The Government Published Dozens of Nude Photos in the Epstein Files
item.description: The photos, which showed young women or possibly teenagers with their faces visible, were largely removed after The New York Times began notifying the Justice Department.
item.dc:creator: Mike Baker and Julie Tate

media:content.media:description: An undated photo of Jeffrey Epstein that was released by the Justice Department.

item.title: 5-Year-Old and His Father, Detained by Agents, Are Released From Custody
item.description: Liam Conejo Ramos, the 5-year-old who was detained with his father by federal agents, is back home in Minnesota with his father. A federal judge demanded their release from an immigration detention center in Texas, where they were being held.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:credit: Joaquin Castro/Joaquin Castro, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Adrian Conejo Arias and his son, 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, are seen in a picture released by Representative Joaquin Castro of Texas after their release from an immigration detention center.

item.title: Fear and Anger Grow as Thousands Remain Without Power in the South
item.description: More than 30 people have died across three Southern states in connection with last week’s storm, and thousands remain without power.
item.dc:creator: Emily Cochrane

media:content.media:description: Crews have been working for a week to restore power in Nashville and surrounding areas after an ice storm damaged the power grid.

item.title: ‘Historic’ Snowstorm Hits the Carolinas, National Weather Service says
item.description: Heavy snow and bitter cold have spread across North and South Carolina, with some areas receiving more than 18 inches of snow.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Silva

item.title: Robert Pratt, Federal Judge Who Derided Trump Pardons, Dies at 78
item.description: He was chastised for remarks ridiculing the pardons of two congressional campaign aides who had been convicted in a bribery plot.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir

media:content.media:credit: Mark Kegans for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Judge Robert Pratt in 2006. He spent 26 years on the federal bench in Iowa, issuing several important rulings.

item.title: 2026 Grammys Red Carpet Photos: Chappell Roan, Tyla, Lady Gaga and More
item.description: See what nominees and guests for the 68th Grammy Awards, including Addison Rae, Bad Bunny and Doechii, wore to arrive to the ceremony.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

media:content.media:description: Addison Rae, a nominee for best new artist, arrived in Alaïa on the red carpet in Los Angeles on Sunday evening.

item.title: Snow, Ice, Parking Hell: It’s a Tough Winter to Be a New York City Mover
item.description: Even in summer, moving crews have to contend with walk-up apartments, double-parking and sofas that won’t fit through narrow hallways. It’s a lot worse right now.
item.dc:creator: Corey Kilgannon

media:content.media:credit: Mimi d’Autremont for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Frozen snowbanks presented an unwelcome obstacle to movers in Brooklyn on the first of the month.

item.title: Grammys 2026: lista completa de ganadores
item.description: Un resumen completo de los artistas, álbumes, canciones y videos que se llevan a casa los trofeos en la 68.ª edición de los premios anuales.

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny ganó el último premio de la noche: el álbum del año.

item.title: Grammy Awards Highlights: Bad Bunny Takes Album of the Year in Groundbreaking Win
item.description: He is the first Spanish-language artist to win the ceremony’s top prize. Kendrick Lamar with SZA took record of the year, and Billie Eilish won song of the year. Lady Gaga, Olivia Dean and Lola Young were also honored.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
